official-title.#text:
Condemning the attack that occurred at the Oak Creek Sikh Gurdwara on August 5, 2012, and honoring
			 the memory of those who died in the attack.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
condemns in the strongest possible terms the horrific attack that occurred at the Sikh Temple of
			 Wisconsin on August 5, 2012;

honors the memory of Suveg Singh Khattra, Satwant Singh Kaleka, Ranjit Singh, Sita Singh, Paramjit
			 Kaur, and Prakash Singh, who died in the attack;

offers its heartfelt condolences to the families, friends, and loved ones of those who died in the
			 attack;

applauds the bravery of Lieutenant Brian Murphy and other first responders who prevented the gunman
			 from potentially taking more lives and quickly treated wounded
			 individuals; and

condemns intolerance, including religious and racial discrimination, and calls for continued
			 vigilance against violence.

Whereas 4 individuals were injured including a responding officer, Lieutenant Brian Murphy, who was
			 shot 15 times at close range;

Whereas the Associated Press reported that more than 700 such incidents of intolerance targeting
			 Sikhs took place over the last decade;

Whereas the Sikh community responded to the shooting in Oak Creek with compassion and stayed true
			 to the Sikh principle of Chardi Kala, remaining in high spirits;

Whereas although the effects of this shooting will be felt for years to come, the Oak Creek
			 community will continue to overcome the tragedy and become stronger than
			 before with a renewed sense of oneness, understanding, and cooperation;
			 and

Whereas the August 5, 2012, shooting was not just a Sikh tragedy, but an American tragedy: Now,
			 therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 698 IH: Condemning the attack that occurred at the Oak Creek Sikh Gurdwara on August 5, 2012, and honoring the memory of those who died in the attack.
